text:
How to get the iPhone's hidden mode that turns your camera into a magnifying glass Apple included a hidden update in its last change - here's how you access it Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Here's how to access the iPhone's hidden magnifying glass feature Share this video Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
In the last iPhone update Apple managed to sneak in a nifty little trick. 
As part of the iOS 10 upgrade it added a few little extras, one being a magnifying tool. 
Accessing the 'hidden' mode in your settings let's you use the iPhone camera to magnify text - or other small things - which could prove useful. 
Once activated it lets you adjust the brightness and colour of your screen making the text your focusing on easier to read. 
Users have already pointed out people who have issues with certain shades or colours could benefit. 
It's actually fairly easy to turn on, it's just knowing how. 
Take a look at the video for a walk through on how to access it. How to switch it on 
To turn it on go to Settings > General > Accessibility . 
Click Magnifier and slide the bar to turn it on. Switch to 'on' 
The next part is easy. 
Just press the home button three times. You can be on the lock screen or in an app - it doesn't matter. 
You get something like this: You can zoom in on text and make adjustments to make it easier to read How to change the colour If you click the White/Blue you can change the colour 
If you click on white/blue you can adjust the colour. 
See, easy.
